questions.question: The long and the short of the matter ………………………….. that we have been betrayed.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more subjects together express one idea.

questions.question: The chairman and the secretary …………………………………. present.
questions.description: The verb must be plural when two or more singular subjects are connected by and.

questions.question: No nook or corner ……………………………… left unexplored.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more singular subjects are connected by or.

questions.question: Neither Sam nor his brother …………………………….. present there.
questions.description: The verb must be singular when two or more singular subjects are connected by neither/nor.

questions.question: Does anyone …………………………… where Celia lives?
questions.description: The infinitive does not take the marker –s after do, does or did.

questions.question: ……………………………… she in love with somebody else?
He and I ……………………………. birds of the same feather.
questions.description: When two singular subjects are connected by and, the verb must be singular.

questions.question: Everybody …………………………….. frustrated by the delay.
questions.description: We use a singular verb after everybody.

questions.question: Tell the children to raise their …………………………….
questions.description: We usually use a plural noun after a plural possessive.

questions.question: Many people lost their …………………………… in the accident.
Neither the minister nor his secretary ………………………………. able to give a satisfactory explanation.
A good knowledge of at least three languages …………………………… essential for this job.
questions.description: Here the actual subject is the singular noun knowledge.
